sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"危险，威胁"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: danger, risk, hazard, menace, peril, threat
means: danger ： 含义广，普通用词，指能够造成伤害、损害或不利的任何情况。
risk ： 指有可能发生的危险，尤指主动进行某种活动或去碰运气而冒的危险。
hazard比risk正式，多指偶然发生的或无法控制的危险，常含较严重或有一定风险的意味。
menace ： 所指的危险性最严重，表示使用暴力或造成破坏性的可能。
peril ： 指迫在眉睫很有可能发生的严重危险。
threat ： 普通用词，语气弱于menace，指任何公开侵犯对方的言行，给对方构成危险或威胁。

sentence.Network_en: In an embarrassing climb-down, the Home Secretary lifted the deportation threat.
sentence.Network_cn: 内务大臣尴尬地作出让步，解除了将其驱逐出境的威胁。

sentence.Network_en: I think your concern is misplaced. Ackroyd is no threat to anyone.
sentence.Network_cn: 我认为你多虑了，阿克罗伊德不会对任何人构成威胁。

sentence.Network_en: A third of Africa is under threat of desertification.
sentence.Network_cn: 非洲有三分之一的土地面临荒漠化的威胁。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English thrēat 'oppression', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch verdrieten 'grieve', German verdriessen 'irritate'

entry.tran: 构成威胁的人(或事物);祸根
entry.def: A threat to a person or thing is a danger that something unpleasant might happen to them. A threat is also the cause of this danger.

example.ex: Some couples see single women as a threat to their relationships...
example.tran: 有些夫妇把单身女人看成是对他们婚姻的威胁。

example.ex: The Hurricane Center warns people not to take the threat of tropical storms lightly...
example.tran: 飓风中心警告人们，不要对热带风暴的危险掉以轻心。

entry.def: A threat is a statement by someone that they will do something unpleasant, especially if you do not do what they want.

example.ex: He may be forced to carry out his threat to resign...
example.tran: 他也许会被迫把自己的辞职威胁付诸行动。

example.ex: The priest remains in hiding after threats by former officials of the ousted dictatorship...
example.tran: 受到被驱逐下台的独裁政府官员的威胁后，那个牧师一直藏匿不出。

entry.def: If a person or thing is under threat, there is a danger that something unpleasant might be done to them, or that they might cease to exist.

example.ex: His position as leader will be under threat at a party congress due next month...
example.tran: 在定于下月举行的党代表大会上，他的领导地位将受到威胁。

example.ex: She lives daily under threat of violence...
example.tran: 她每天都生活在暴力威胁之下。

means.word_mean: 1. something that is a source of danger;

sentences.sentence: "earthquakes are a constant threat in Japan"

means.word_mean: 2. a warning that something unpleasant is imminent;
3. declaration of an intention or a determination to inflict harm on another;

sentences.sentence: "his threat to kill me was quite explicit"

means.word_mean: 4. a person who inspires fear or dread;

sentences.sentence: "he was the terror of the neighborhood"

sentences.en: His threats are just talk.Don't worry!
sentences.cn: 他的威胁只不过是虚张声势的空话而已, 不要担心！

means.word_mean: 可能造成威胁的人[事, 想法]

sentences.en: The use of nuclear weapons is a horrible threat to the species.
sentences.cn: 核武器对人类是一个严重威胁。

sentences.en: The threat of bankruptcy hung over the company.
sentences.cn: 那家公司出现了破产的预兆。

jushi.english: The United Nations are trying to free the world from the threat of war.
jushi.chinese: 联合国力图使世界免于战争的威胁。

jushi.english: The threat of bankruptcy hung over the company.
jushi.chinese: 那家公司出现了破产的预兆。

jushi.english: They carried out their threat to kill him.
